painpoints.title: Envy others speaking fluent English?
painpoints.subtitle: It’s not that you can’t learn — you just haven’t found the right path yet.
painpoints.point1_title: Weak foundation and don’t know where to start?
painpoints.point1_desc: Too much grammar, too much disorganized knowledge. You just want to begin but go back to zero. Your learning plan stays on the drawing board.
painpoints.point2_title: Practising alone is too boring and lacks external motivation, you can’t stick with it?
painpoints.point2_desc: No instant feedback, no learning partner — the process becomes lonely and dull. Enthusiasm quickly fades, you give up halfway, all efforts wasted.
painpoints.point3_title: Knowing words from books but can’t use them in real conversation?
painpoints.point3_desc: Rote-memorised knowledge doesn’t turn into fluent expression. Without real situational training, you end up “knowing for exams, not knowing how to speak”.
